article-meta.issue-title: Special Issue: The Sociology of Art

body.p: From the photo-essay “La Poesía Esta En La Calle (Poetry Is In The Streets),” in A Politics of Imagination in Argentina.

The visual discourse of the city speaks in surfaces, masking as much as it reveals. The eyes and gaze of this branded woman implore us to meet and conspire in a curious yet bounded recognition. As we walk these streets, tracking the city’s urban canvas of dreams, are we content to live as so many spectators, passing by in private assent? Are we willing to consciously engage and to share our awareness as it blooms, leading us forward? Or, will we simply walk on by?

sec.title: About the Artist
sec.p: Dustin R. Hiles is a professional photographer and educator specializing in visual ethnography, documentary, commemorative, and fine art photography. Hiles’ creative research interests include visual culture, representation, and cultural memory, as well as the roles of consciousness, creativity, and agency in society. He has held multiple exhibits of his photography, mostly in the Southwestern United States. Hiles holds master's degrees in sustainable communities and bilingual and multicultural education.
To view more of Hiles’ photography, please visit http://images-with-imagination.com/.
